name: Atmo
headline: Ultra-precise AI weather forecasting.
description: Atmo is the leading company bringing artificial intelligence to meteorology for governments, militaries, and corporations. Atmo builds state-of-the-art AI weather forecasts that are up to 50% more accurate, 10x more detailed, and run 40,000x faster. Atmo has rapidly become the trusted AI meteorology partner for high-stakes users worldwide, such as the US Department of Defense, top aerospace companies, the Philippines, and the United Nations. Today, Atmo forecasting systems protect vital infrastructure and enhance economic activity for its partners, including disaster response, renewable energy, agriculture, transportation, and national security.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:machine-learning; industry:weather; industry:climate; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Alex Levy, Founder
founders.description: Leveraging AI to revolutionize the physical sciences, Alex Levy is the CEO and co-founder of Atmo, the leading company integrating AI into global weather forecasting. Previously, he co-founded Atomwise (W15), a pioneering AI company in small molecule drug discovery, boasting over 800 active programs and $1 billion in pharmaceutical partnerships. An alumnus of the University of Toronto, he began his career by leading a computer vision research lab within the Computer Science Department.

founders.name: Johan Mathe, Founder
founders.description: As co-founder and CTO of Atmo, Johan spearheads groundbreaking advancements in climate and weather science, leveraging AI, applied mathematics, and distributed systems. His lifelong mission is to bring applied mathematics and AI to the physical sciences. His expertise is backed by an 8-year tenure at Google, including Google X's Project Loon, where he lead critical efforts in the planning and simulation, and as a founding team member of Caption Health (acq. 2023) and Apollo Fusion (IPO 2021).

## Worldwide real-time data
Atmo collects Earth’s weather measurement data in real-time from the vast majority of weather satellites, ground stations, radars and ocean buoys. Our AI models use this data to continuously refine forecasts and improve their forecasting ability. 
## Lightning-fast forecasts
Weather changes fast. Atmo AI weather models deliver forecasts even faster. Up to 40,000 times quicker than traditional models. 
## Accuracy, elevated
Atmo is up to 50% more accurate than today’s most advanced forecasts across major prognostic and diagnostic variables, for time scales ranging from nowcasting (24 hours) to medium-range (14 days).
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/663b054598a372edb070cf86/66455e47b56b84c9b1efb01f_Globe%20Update.webp)
[Data Sourcing](http://atmo.ai/<#>)[Prediction Speed](http://atmo.ai/<#>)[Benchmarking & Verification](http://atmo.ai/<#>)

## Lightning-fast forecasts
Weather changes fast. Atmo AI weather models deliver forecasts even faster. Up to 40,000 times quicker than traditional models.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/663b054598a372edb070cf86/66455e47b56b84c9b1efb01f_Globe%20Update.webp)

## Accuracy, elevated
Atmo is up to 50% more accurate than today’s most advanced forecasts across major prognostic and diagnostic variables, for time scales ranging from nowcasting (24 hours) to medium-range (14 days).
Extreme Resolution
## Nano-climates Revealed
Atmo delivers forecasts with up to 100 times greater detail. With models as fine as 1km by 1km, Atmo offers unprecedented clarity in predicting weather for microclimates within larger climates.
[See Ultra Resolution Forecast](http://atmo.ai/<https:/sf.atmo.ai/wind>)
→
Trusted globally: at work for governments, militaries, and industries. Atmo is trusted by the most sophisticated customers, including the United States Air Force, Navy and the Philippines national government, to deliver forecasts that are rigorously proven, in live production, and specially tailored to challenging environments.

generated_description:
Atmo, founded in 2020 and located in San Francisco, is on a mission to revolutionize the way we forecast weather using ultra-precise AI technology. They’ve made a name for themselves as a leader in combining artificial intelligence with meteorology, catering to high-stakes clients like the US Department of Defense, top aerospace firms, and even the United Nations. 

Their weather forecasts boast a remarkable accuracy increase of up to 50%, are 10 times more detailed, and delivered at lightning speed—40,000 times faster than traditional methods. This level of precision makes Atmo an invaluable partner for sectors that depend on reliable weather data, including disaster response, renewable energy, agriculture, transportation, and national security.

Atmo's forecasting systems leverage real-time data from a diverse array of sources: weather satellites, ground stations, radars, and ocean buoys. This data feeds into their advanced AI models, which not only enhance current forecasting abilities but also refine them continuously. With a focus on "nano-climates," their models can provide weather predictions with staggering detail, as fine as 1km², crucial for understanding localized weather phenomena.

The insightful team of 10 employees is supported by experienced partners from Y Combinator, and they aim to empower government and industry leaders with superior forecast tools to protect citizens and optimize operations. If you’re interested in their work or want to join their efforts, you can find more about Atmo on their website: [atmo.ai](http://atmo.ai).

In a world where weather unpredictability can lead to significant disruptions, Atmo stands at the forefront of meteorological innovation, promising to equip its users with the foresight necessary to navigate the complexities of our climate.
